Toast notification for key pair generation is fired unconditionally on
activity start, even if it is actually underway or even completed.

First tests on (re)connection policy (#126)

On CONNECTED to mobile network events, Kontalk will try to connect only
if the last attempt was before the defined wakeup time.

Fix #156: set ComposeMessage activity launch mode to standard

For some reason ComposeMessage had singleTop launch mode. While this
might have something to do with a past design, it doesn't make sense
now.

Signed-off-by: Daniele Ricci <daniele.athome@gmail.com>
Merge branch 'master' into blockuser

Release wake lock as soon as we are authenticated

Trying to address the problems pointed out in issue #143. The main problem here is wake locks are too long-lived or too much. We can't
lower the number of wake locks, but we can do something to make them
shorter. This, however, puts the app in danger of losing the connection to the server when the device is put on standby.

Remember last push notification and overrule connection policies (closes #126)

When a push notification is received and the message center could not
connect for whatever reason, the connection policy should be temporarly
disabled to allow the app to retrieve the incoming messages waiting for
us.
